process.name: Test New Calendar
process.narrative: Tests a non-default calendar (with public and other holidays)

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to search for

input.name: Dates
input.narrative: The dates to search

output.name: Found
output.narrative: Flag indicating if the date was found in the collection or not

field.name: Date
field.description: The date to check

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar to delete

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar

input.name: Working Week
input.narrative: A collection of days which should make up the working week for this calendar

input.name: Public Holiday Group
input.narrative: The public holiday group to set in this calendar. Empty leaves the public holiday group unset

input.name: Disabled Public Holidays
input.narrative: The public holidays (by label) to disable, ie. treat as working days in the calendar

input.name: Other Holidays
input.narrative: Other holidays to set in this calendar

field.name: Name
field.description: The full name of the public holiday to disable

field.name: Date
field.description: The date to set into the other holidays

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar

input.name: Working Week
input.narrative: A collection of days which should make up the working week for this calendar

input.name: Public Holiday Group
input.narrative: The public holiday group to set in this calendar. Empty leaves the public holiday group unset

input.name: Disabled Public Holidays
input.narrative: The public holidays (by label) to disable, ie. treat as working days in the calendar

input.name: Other Holidays
input.narrative: Other holidays to set in this calendar

field.name: Name
field.description: The full name of the public holiday to disable

field.name: Date
field.description: The date to set into the other holidays

input.name: Calendar Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar

input.name: From
input.narrative: The first date of the range

input.name: To
input.narrative: The last date of the range

input.name: Expected Working Days
input.narrative: The days expected to be returned as working days according to the calendar

input.name: Expected Public Holidays
input.narrative: The days expected to be public holidays in the range

input.name: Expected Other Holidays
input.narrative: The days expected to be other holidays in the range

field.name: Date
field.description: The date which represents a working day

field.name: Date
field.description: A working date as defined by the specified calendar which falls from First Date up to and including Last Date

input.name: Calendar Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar defined in System Manager

input.name: First Date
input.narrative: The first date to consider working days from

input.name: Last Date
input.narrative: The last date to consider working days until

output.name: Working Days
output.narrative: The working days which fall between the specified dates (inclusive)

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to search for

input.name: Dates
input.narrative: The dates to search

output.name: Found
output.narrative: Flag indicating if the date was found in the collection or not

input.name: Calendar Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar defined in System Manager

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to consider whether it is a working day or not

output.name: Is Working Day
output.narrative: True to indicate the given date was a working day, False otherwise

exception.detail: "Expected working days does not match the working days returned"
"Date: " & [Current] & " - should it be a working day? I say that this is " & [Should be Working Day] & "; but the action thinks it is " & [Is Working Day]

input.name: Calendar Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar defined in System Manager

input.name: First Date
input.narrative: The first date to consider working days from

input.name: Last Date
input.narrative: The last date to consider working days until

output.name: Days
output.narrative: The number of working days found within the specified range, inclusive

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection whose rows are to be counted

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

exception.detail: "Expected working day count (" & [Expected Count] & ") does not match the count returned (" & [Count] & ")"

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar to delete

output.name: Deleted
output.narrative: Flag indicating if the calendar was deleted by this action (True) or if it didn't exist in the first place (False)

field.name: Date
field.description: The date which represents a working day

field.name: Date
field.description: The date which represents a working day

input.narrative: The name of the calendar defined in System Manager

input.name: First Date
input.narrative: The first date to consider public holidays from

input.name: Last Date
input.narrative: The last date to consider public holidays until

output.name: Public Holidays
output.narrative: The public holidays which fall between the specified dates (inclusive)

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection whose rows are to be counted

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

input.name: Calendar Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar defined in System Manager

input.name: First Date
input.narrative: The first date to consider other holidays from

input.name: Last Date
input.narrative: The last date to consider other holidays until

output.name: Other Holidays
output.narrative: The other holidays which fall between the specified dates (inclusive)

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection whose rows are to be counted

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

exception.detail: "Expected " & [Expected Count] & " public holidays in range: " & [From] & " - " & [To] & "; Instead, found: " & [Count]

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection whose rows are to be counted

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

exception.detail: "Expected " & [Expected Count] & " other holidays in range: " & [From] & " - " & [To] & "; Instead, found: " & [Count]

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection whose rows are to be counted

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

exception.detail: "Expected public holidays does not match the public holidays returned"
"Expected other holidays does not match the other holidays returned"

stage.name: PublicHols-SPRING
stage.narrative: Note - NOT Easter Monday - not a public holiday in Scotland

field.name: Date
field.description: The date of the public holiday enabled on the calendar

field.name: Name
field.description: The name of the public holiday

field.name: Date
field.description: The date of the other holiday defined on the calendar

field.name: Date
field.description: The date which represents a working day

stage.name: PublicHols-NOV
stage.narrative: Note that St Andrews' Day is disabled so should not appear here

field.name: Date
field.description: The date of the public holiday enabled on the calendar

field.description: The name of the public holiday

input.name: From

input.name: Calendar Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar defined in System Manager

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to check

output.name: Is Public Holiday
output.narrative: True to indicate that the given date falls on a public holiday; False otherwise

output.name: Name
output.narrative: If date is a public holiday, this contains the label of that public holiday, otherwise blank

exception.detail: "Public holiday '" & [Expected Public Holidays.Name] & " should occur on " & [Expected Public Holidays.Date] & " - IsPublicHoliday returns False for that date"
"Public holiday on " & [Expected Public Holidays.Date] & " should be called '" & [Expected Public Holidays.Name] & "' - IsPublicHoliday says it is called '" & [Public Holiday Name] & "'"

input.name: Calendar Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar defined in System Manager

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to check

output.name: Is Other Holiday
output.narrative: True to indicate that the given date falls on an other holiday; False otherwise

exception.detail: "An 'Other Holiday' should occur on " & [Expected Other Holidays.Date] & " - IsOtherHoliday returns False for that date"

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to search for

input.name: Dates
input.narrative: The dates to search

output.name: Found
output.narrative: Flag indicating if the date was found in the collection or not

input.name: Calendar Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar defined in System Manager

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to check

output.name: Is Weekend
output.narrative: True to indicate that the given date falls outside the working working week defined in the calendar; False otherwise.

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to search for

input.name: Dates
input.narrative: The dates to search

output.name: Found
output.narrative: Flag indicating if the date was found in the collection or not

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to search for

input.name: Dates
input.narrative: The dates to search

output.name: Found
output.narrative: Flag indicating if the date was found in the collection or not

stage.name: Correct?
stage.narrative: Correct if 'Is Weekend' returns true and it is not a working day -or- if 'Is Weekend' returns false and it's either a working day or another type of holiday.

decision.expression: ([Is Weekend] AND [Is Expected Working Day] = False) OR ([Is Weekend] = False AND ([Is Expected Working Day] OR [Is Expected Public Holiday] OR [Is Expected Other Holiday]))

exception.detail: "'Is Weekend' is wrong for the date: " & [Current] & " - it returns " & [Is Weekend] & " - Expected Working Day: " & [Is Expected Working Day] & "; Expected Public Holiday: " & [Is Expected Public Holiday] & "; Expected Other Holiday: " & [Is Expected Other Holiday]

stage.name: Note3
stage.narrative: Note: This isn't an exhaustive test - we can't test that (say) 29/02 correctly returns false for "Is Weekend", because if it returned true, this would still pass (due to it being an 'Other Holiday')

field.name: Date
field.description: The date to add working days to

field.name: Days
field.description: The number of working days to add

field.name: Expected Result
field.description: The expected result from Add Working Days

stage.name: For Each Add Working Day Test

input.name: Calendar Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar defined in System Manager

input.name: Date
input.narrative: The date to which the number of working days should be added

input.name: Days
input.narrative: The number of days to be added. Note that a value of zero will always return Start Date, even if it is not a working day

output.name: Result Date
output.narrative: The date with the specified number of days added to it

exception.detail: "AddWorkingDays('" & [Add Working Day Tests.Date] & "', " & [Add Working Day Tests.Days] & ") - should return '" & [Add Working Day Tests.Expected Result] & "', but actually returned: " & [Result Date]

stage.name: Pause
stage.narrative: The calendars update every 10 seconds - ensure they are updated before continuing.

input.name: Tree Name
input.narrative: Name of the tree to be extended.

input.name: Item Name
input.narrative: Name of the item to be clicked on.

input.name: Select Item Method?
input.narrative: True by Default. Selects the node from system tab using Select Item approach. If the node is not available (Greyed out) an exception will be thrown. Use this method if you are certain the node is available for selection.

input.name: Retry MouseClick?
input.narrative: Default to True. Retries Global Mouse Click up to 3 times.

input.name: Clean Up?
input.narrative: False by Default. Set True if clean up is required at the beginning of the Action.

input.name: Tab Name
input.narrative: Name of Tab to Click

input.name: Tab Name
input.narrative: Name of Tab to Click

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar

input.name: Create If Missing
input.narrative: Flag to indicate if the calendar should be created if it is not defined. If False, an exception will be raised in this case

input.narrative: The name of the calendar

input.name: Working Week
input.narrative: A collection of days which should make up the working week for this calendar

input.name: Public Holiday Group
input.narrative: The public holiday group to set in this calendar. Empty leaves the public holiday group unset

input.name: Disabled Public Holidays
input.narrative: The public holidays (by label) to disable, ie. treat as working days in the calendar

input.name: Other Holidays
input.narrative: Other holidays to set in this calendar

input.name: Tree Name
input.narrative: Name of the tree to be extended.

input.name: Item Name
input.narrative: Name of the item to be clicked on.

input.name: Select Item Method?
input.narrative: True by Default. Selects the node from system tab using Select Item approach. If the node is not available (Greyed out) an exception will be thrown. Use this method if you are certain the node is available for selection.

input.name: Retry MouseClick?
input.narrative: Default to True. Retries Global Mouse Click up to 3 times.

input.name: Clean Up?
input.narrative: False by Default. Set True if clean up is required at the beginning of the Action.

input.name: Tab Name
input.narrative: Name of Tab to Click

input.name: Tab Name
input.narrative: Name of Tab to Click

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the calendar

input.name: Create If Missing
input.narrative: Flag to indicate if the calendar should be created if it is not defined. If False, an exception will be raised in this case

output.name: pid
output.narrative: PID of the process

input.name: pid
input.narrative: PID to attach to
